snippet: A projected life-size image of a woman explains where to find taxi stands and baggage claim every time someone comes within 30 feet.
abstract: La Guardia Airport's newest employee, Marie, is a projected life-size avatar giving visitors directions to taxi stands, baggage claim and other useful information; an identical avatar was unveiled at Newark Liberty International Airport in July and a third is planned for Kennedy Airport as well.

headline.main: At La Guardia, a Smiling Helper Materializes, Digitally
headline.print_headline: La Guardia’s New Helper Repeats Herself

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

snippet: The setback from the Nexus Q reveals deeper challenges for Google as it tries to move into two new areas: hardware and social technology.
abstract: Setback for Google's Nexus Q device for streaming video and music reveals deeper challenges for the company as it tries to move into two new areas: hardware and social technology; analysts say one problem is that most people have not purchased much in the way of music and movies from the firm.

headline.main: Google Goes Back to the Drawing Board for Nexus Q
headline.print_headline: Back to the Drawing Board for Nexus Q

snippet: The relegation of the financially troubled Glasgow Rangers to the lowest division of Scottish soccer may forever transform a heated rivalry with Celtic.
abstract: Relegation of the financially troubled Glasgow Rangers to the lowest division of Scottish soccer threatens to transform a long-time heated rivalry with Celtic.

snippet: The computer maker has aggressively spent on deal-making, paying billions of dollars for businesses like E.D.S., Palm, Compaq and, more recently, Autonomy, but few acquisitions have panned out.
abstract: The computer maker has aggressively spent on deal-making, paying billions of dollars for businesses like E.D.S., Palm, Compaq and, more recently, Autonomy, but few acquisitions have panned out.

snippet: In the wake of the New York State regulator's allegations that Standard Chartered of Britain helped Iran launder $250 billion, the Federal Reserve and the Justice Department are now in the uncomfortable position of deciding what to do with their i...
abstract: In the wake of the New York State regulator's allegations that Standard Chartered of Britain helped Iran launder $250 billion, the Federal Reserve and the Justice Department are now in the uncomfortable position of deciding what to do with their investigations.

headline.main: What's Next in the Standard Chartered Case

snippet: Apple freezes over-the-phone password changes, tech designers and developers struggle to get paid and Microsoft conceptualizes the connected home.

snippet: Apple temporarily disabled the ability for customers to reset their Apple ID passwords by calling customer service after a hacker broke into a journalist’s account over the weekend.
abstract: Apple temporarily disabled the ability for customers to reset their Apple ID passwords by calling customer service after a hacker broke into a journalist’s account over the weekend.

headline.main: Apple Stops Password Resets Over the Phone

snippet: As a civil war rages in Syria, the conflict is playing out on a smaller scale in Syrian Druse villages in the Golan Heights, with violence occasionally flaring.
abstract: Buqata Journal; Syria's civil war is playing out on a smaller scale in Syrian Druse villages on the Golan Heights, where divisions are sharpening between those loyal to Pres Bashar al-Assad and an increasingly vocal group of opponents; both sides express a fear that conflict will lead to widespread bloodshed, as families are riven by differing opinions and demonstrations occasionally devolve into violence.

headline.main: Echoes of Syria’s War in the Golan Heights
headline.print_headline: Echoes of Syria’s War In the Golan Heights
